Text.Text: Another warrior come for healing from Ragni?  The only people welcome in this house are those who give or take blood.  Are you one of the brave, or are you just another talker?
Good.  The attackers are ferocious.  What they lack in skill they make up for in numbers.  Even when the cowardly goblins fall back, fresh ones take their place.
STILL YOUR WAGGING TONGUE!  You waste breath while brave men gasp their last not a league from where we stand!
Hrnhh... feel free to do good as long as you do it well.  What can I do for you?
Excellent.  May your courage last longer than your flesh.   We must let our deeds set an example for the people of the Ten-Towns.
Hrmph.  When your clever words, sneering, and intimidation fail, you'd best be ready for war, priest.  What do you want?
HA HA HA!  Indeed, my friend.  Your people are rightfully known for their skill and bravery in battle.  How can I be of aid?
You think too much, Denham.  If you spent as much time fighting as you spend talking and thinking about fighting, you'd be wrestling dragons daily.  Now then... what can I for you?
RRRRRRR!  Enough!  In your prayers, bard, count yourself Tymora-blessed that Denham talked me out of bashing your foolish head.  Now, what do you want?
For the moment, all is well.  Some goblins tried to thrash the Palisade with their feeble weapons.  They failed miserably.  They are disorganized.  If this continues, the battle will be easily won.
Denham, I don't need a sermon on how goblins fight.  I've slain more of those black-blooded bastards than anyone in this town.
It doesn't matter how many bugbears they have with them.  Hack enough of them in twain with an axe and the rest head for the mountains.
Keep talking, Denham.  We shall see what happens.  Hrmph.  Now, is there something I can help you with?
Things appear grim.  Bremen has been sacked by a horde of goblins led by those stinking bugbears.  They were flying a strange banner... it bore a three-headed beast known as the chimera.
AND I TOLD YOU THAT IF YOU MEET GOBLINS WITH ENOUGH FORCE, THEY'LL BREAK AND RUN!  Grrr... Now, how else can I help you?
We know nothing.  Our books on heraldry contain no note of such a banner.  We will be performing auguries soon to see if divination will reveal the source of their sign.

We are in the belly of the beast.  The only way out is through flesh and bone.  Goblins are at the Palisade.  I fought for a while on the front lines last night.  I recommend you go there yourself as soon as possible.
Thanks to you and the people of Targos, Veiros rode on our side of the battlefield.  The goblins have been beaten back... but for how long, our auguries cannot say.
Tempus is the god of battle and warfare.  He teaches us to embrace conflict as the heart of civilization.  Ask the people of the Ten-Towns what war is, and they'd probably say it is savagery.
Nothing could be further from the truth.  War is the civilized expression of independence and personal belief.
From duelists fighting over a breach of honor to nations clashing over a stretch of land, each victory represents our world's progress.
It is the error of man to forget those who have died for their beliefs.  All warriors who die with valor and bravery are to be honored and remembered in reverence.  Such is the way of Tempus.
You have returned.  What aid do you seek from the Lord of Battles?
Even if the villagers of the Ten-Towns do not remember, what you did here will always be remembered by Tempus.  What aid do you seek from the Lord of Battles?
Poorly?  Ha!  Denham, we did fine.  We knocked back every mob that came forward.
WHAT?!  Are you ill in the head, Denham?!  Bremen's been sacked!  How is that possibly good for us?
Supporting cowards.  Bah!  Sometimes I doubt the Red Knight's followers are really Tempuran!
AHEM!

Ha!  If you can meet up with the Neverwinter forces, then you must have wings on your feet and the speed of an eagle.  They'll be no couriers running to the Neverwinter forces from Targos this season.
Hold on to your letter, and pass it along when the reinforcements arrive.  For now, keep your thoughts on killing goblins.
What are you doing here?!  There's word of an attack on the Docks, and goblins to be slaughtered!
You'll find none here as long as Targos' life hangs poised beneath a goblin blade!  NOW GO!
So the shapeshifter Garradun chose to lair under the shadow of Tempus?  A swift lesson you taught the beast!  If there's more about, then they'll receive more of the same!
So the shapeshifter Garradun chose to lair under the shadow of Tempus?  A swift lesson you taught the beast!  Ha!  As for you - what aid do you seek from the Lord of Battles?
So the shapeshifter Garradun chose to lair under the shadow of Tempus?  A swift lesson you taught the beast!  Ha!  As for you - what aid do you seek from the Lord of Battles?
The shapeshifter wanted you to deliver a letter, did he?  Best show it to Denham - it smells of treachery, it does.  Denham!  Look at this.
<CHARNAME> is my name, and I am here to inspire the fallen with songs to stir their hearts and calm th-
By all that is holy and just in this world, I swear I will aid this town in its fight against evil.
I am a fellow Battleguard of Tempus.  I am here to fight.
Tempurans.  You sit around and wait for war to come.  If we from the church of Bane were in charge, this army would have been crushed long ago.
I am here to spread Selune's light, and let her light help all find their chosen path through these dark times.
I'm an Ilmatari, a Painbearer of Ilmater.  I have come to see what aid I may offer to the suffering of Targos.
I am a Morninglord of Lathander, come to see that Targos survives to see the coming dawn.
I am a Watcher of Helm.  I am here to guard Targos' walls against any threat.
I am a Lorekeeper of Oghma... and hope to add my knowledge to the weapons of Targos' defenders.
Greetings, Tempuran - I am a Demarch of Mask, here to see how my skills may aid Targos.
A Tempuran skulking in his tent, talking of war - if you gave this battle to the Stormlords of Talos, then there would be no goblinoids alive in the North.
Axes, hammers, or blades.  Whatever ye have, give 'em to the dwarves.  We'll sort this mess out.
We came to help in the war effort, yes.
Do you know where I can meet up with the captain of the Neverwinter Forces?  Garradun Tanner wanted me to deliver this letter to him.
Do you know where I can meet up with the captain of the Neverwinter Forces?  Garradun Tanner wanted me to deliver this letter to him.
I seek healing.
How goes the battle?
How goes the battle?
How goes the battle?
How goes the battle?
What can you tell me about Tempus?
Nothing right now, Ragni.  Farewell.
Do you know where I can meet up with the captain of the Neverwinter Forces?  Garradun Tanner wanted me to deliver this letter to him.
Do you know where I can meet up with the captain of the Neverwinter Forces?  Garradun Tanner wanted me to deliver this letter to him.

What about those who are not victorious?
I seek healing.
Farewell, Ragni.

Farewell, Ragni.

Very well.  I seek healing.
How goes the battle?
What can you tell me about Tempus?
Nothing right now, Ragni.  Farewell.
I came in search of healing.
Very well.  We'll return when the Docks belong to Targos again.
Very well.  We'll return when the Docks belong to Targos again.
His presence may coincide with the attack on the Docks.  I'd best head there now.
I hope so.  The docks are still in need of our blades, however.  Farewell.

I seek healing.
How goes the battle?
How goes the battle?
How goes the battle?
How goes the battle?
What can you tell me about Tempus?
Aid?  After you didn't lift a finger while we were fighting that shapeshifter?  We don't need any aid today, thanks.
Nothing right now, Ragni.  Farewell.
